page.title: 14Stambourne-Toppesfield,Halls
page.content: Many social activities take place in our village halls.Stambourne Hall was built in 1861 as the local school.The school closed 26 years ago and a committee was formed to purchase the building.It is now used regularly by Stambourne Players Drama Club,the W.I. Silver Link senior citizens' club and for Parish Council meetings,dog train- ing,whist drives and similar events. Toppesfield Hall was built by public subscription in 1961 on a site donated by brewers Greene King & Sons Ltd.The premises are owned by the Parish Council but are managed by a Board and are financially self-supporting.This attractive and well-maintained build- ing,which has been criticised for the inadequacy of the overhead heating,is used regularly by the local school,the playgroup,W.I.,Good Companions senior citizens' Club and for private hire.
